greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = pi(n)+pi(k)-pi(n+k), n >= 2, 2 <= k <= n, where pi() = A000720().
comment: It is conjectured that pi(x)+pi(y) >= pi(x+y) for 1 < y <= x.
reference: D. S. Mitrinovic et al., Handbook of Number Theory, Kluwer, Section VII.5, p. 235.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 2..150 of triangle, flattened

P. Erdos and J. L. Selfridge, Complete prime subsets of consecutive integers. Proceedings of the Manitoba Conference on Numerical Mathematics (Univ. Manitoba, Winnipeg, Man., 1971), pp. 1--14. Dept. Comput. Sci., Univ. Manitoba, Winnipeg, Man., 1971. MR0337828 (49 #2597).
mathematica: t[n_, k_] := PrimePi[n] + PrimePi[k] - PrimePi[n+k]; Flatten[ Table[t[n, k], {n, 2, 13}, {k, 2, n}]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 21 2012 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 04 2012
